dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: hip
dependencies.description:
HIP is a C++ Runtime API and Kernel Language that allows developers to
create portable applications for AMD and NVIDIA GPUs from single source
code.

dependencies.name: rocm-cmake
dependencies.description:
ROCM cmake modules provides cmake modules for common build tasks needed
for the ROCM software stack

dependent_to.name: gearshifft
dependent_to.description: Benchmark Suite for Heterogenuous FFT Implementations

dependent_to.name: hipace
dependent_to.description:
Highly efficient Plasma Accelerator Emulation, quasistatic particle-in-
cell code

dependent_to.name: spfft
dependent_to.description: Sparse 3D FFT library with MPI, OpenMP, CUDA and ROCm support.

dependent_to.name: hipfft
dependent_to.description:
hipFFT is an FFT marshalling library. Currently, hipFFT supports either
rocFFT or cuFFT as backends.hipFFT exports an interface that does not
require the client to change, regardless of the chosen backend. It sits
between the application and the backend FFT library, marshalling inputs
into the backend and results back to the application.

dependent_to.name: warpx
dependent_to.description:
WarpX is an advanced electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell code. It supports
many features including Perfectly-Matched Layers (PML) and mesh
refinement. In addition, WarpX is a highly-parallel and highly-optimized
code and features hybrid OpenMP/MPI parallelization, advanced
vectorization techniques and load balancing capabilities. For WarpX'
Python bindings and PICMI input support, see the 'py-warpx' package.
